data.title: Great food/Service
data.text:
We stopped here in early September.  Looking for a decent place to eat.  Great food.
four course meal with liquer or root beer float for desert.

Quaint.  Western.  Delicious. Friendly.  
Not a fast food place.  We'll be back again

data.title: Worst food ever
data.text: My family and I ate here for Christmas Eve. The food arrived cold. The men's restroom was not wheelchair accessible and I had to have my mom guard the ladies room door while I used that.

data.title: Lukewarm food, service brings lukewarm review
data.text: We decided to go for their Christmas eve special evening.  The table was not ready at the time of reservation--that was not a problem, but the service was as it took a very long time to even get water.  Other smaller parties were served much more quickly.  The soup arrived very lukewarm though delicious. The remainder of the meal was simply adequate--nothing special.  Perhaps best were the garlic mashed potatoes.  The main courses were ordinary and in some cases very meager-- one should have been full at this stage but we were not. No bread was served.  The ribeye steaks were okay but quite full of fat.  The shrimp fest was good.  The prime rib so so.  Perhaps best were the tri tips.  Root beer float was fun and after dinner drinks okay.  Men's bathroom miniscule and difficult to maneuver.  All in all, you can give this place a miss or try it on a night when it is not busy

data.title: Delicious, start to finish
data.text:
This was a wonderful dining experience. Situated near the center of Eugene, it is located in a charming Century home that has been furnished to maximize that homey, warm feel.  We were lucky to be seated in front of a large window where we could watch Eugene drive by while dining.

The food, while seemingly expensive evolves over the course of dinner to be a very good deal.  Dinner not only includes the entrée but soup, salad, potatoes, vegetable and finally, a choice between an after dinner cordial or a root beer float.  Dinner is also served family style rather than individual servings.  

I can honestly say that every bite was a taste treat while the service was excellent.

data.title: Tasty food with service to match
data.text: Very unpretentious surroundings but wonderful vibe and friendly service. The steaks were superb and well prepared with tasty veggies and and extras.

user_location.name: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

data.title: A superb meal
data.text:
This is one of those mock Western Cowboy spots. Some can be bad. This one is good.

The wall items are different, the lighting is low, the frills are few

BUT

the food is supremely good Western food. Juicy steaks of a challenging size cooked by somebody who knows what he is doing; a decent soup , fresh fish alternatives

All

bettered by a pleasant atmosphere, helpful, cheerful, willing staff and a sensible pricing policy

data.title: Good Food & Drink in a Converted House!!!
data.text:
Came in late on night and saw the Bates as I was driving!!
Turned around and was pleasantly surprised by the converted older house atmosphere!!  And the collection of Cowboy Hats in every room...
Very good food served by friendly staff at price that didn't break the bank..
I'd go back....

data.title: Once was enough.
data.text: We went for our anniversary hoping for a special meal and were disappointed in the quality of the food. The protein choice which was prepared well, was accompanied by a set menue of side dishes. These included a veggie soup that tasted like it had been cooking for days and 'cowboy' potatoes that were greasy and seasoned too heavily with salt and rosemary. Dessert, also included in the price of the meal, was either a rootbeer float or an after dinner drink. If you like steak and nothing else matters, this may be a good choice. However, if you are looking for imaginative well prepared food, would not recommend.

data.title: Charm and Good Food
data.text: Bates has a fun country feel. They do things their own way but the result is amazing food and usually lots of it. Meals come with salad, cowboy soup, potatoes and rice, and an after dinner drink. Very fun and very tasty.

data.title: Food was great
data.text: The food at Bates was excellent.  We will choose to eat there again.  We were walk ins early in the dinner hour and there was only one other table in the restaurant.  Our ONLY complaint  was that when another group of 3 came in they were seated right next to us - about 18" away on the bench seat.  With only one other table being occupied, it would have been nice had the sat the new group at least across the aisle from us as they were loud and well informed on every subject.

data.title: Business Travel
data.text: I was passing thru town and staid at the local Holiday Inn.  I didn't want hotel food so the locals from the Holiday in suggested this place.   I'm from Upstate NY and the other person I was travelling from is from Texas.   He knows his steaks, me not so much.   But I do appreciate good salads, soups and drinks.   Both of us left saying you don't find many hidden treasures like that.  Certainly the price comments on other reviews should not be taken to seriously.  I thought for the amount of food you are served the price was more than fair.   The steak came with a salad, Soup and bread all of which were better than any chain restaurant.

data.title: Middle of the road
data.text: I have to say that I was totally un-impressed with the general caliber of restaurants in Downtown Eugene. After a long day of travel I had dinner at Bates Steak house and it was OK but far below the average steak house in that price range.  There's no atmosphere to speak of, it's a house converted to a restaurant/bar. The waitress was friendly, prompt and got our orders right; I couldn't ask for anymore in that regard. The food was decent but not up to par for the prices charged. This apparently is the norm in Eugene; an over paid, entitled workforce coupled with lots of regulation and taxes that drives the price of service up without a corresponding increase in quality. This steakhouse would go out of business in less than a week in any East coast city!  It's is sadly the norm on the left coast. I would have ranked Bates lower but frankly, it seemed to be one of the better establishments in hippie'ville Oregon

data.title: Better then you'd expect after some of these reviews
data.text: My wife and I were in Eugene overnight in route to Portland, and having stayed in Eugene before, we weren't expecting great food.  We stumbled onto Bates Steakhouse and we were going to skip it based upon recent reviews, but with a full bar and near the hotel after a long day of driving...why not?  Much to our surprise, we stepped back into an old western saloon type restaurant  and the house has quite a bit of history.  Meat is their main thing (hence the name) and it's served family style.  A tureen of soup with sides of beans, onions and salsa start you off, then a salad and then the main course.  We had steak and the prime rib--both were average to good.  After dinner you get either a liqueur or float--we passed.  It was all better than we thought or expected.  Service was good...although started slowly.  Certainly on the upscale side based upon the bill, but we've paid more and eaten worse.  We'd go back, so that's a positive.  Don't expect the best meal you've ever had and you won't be disappointed.

data.title: VERY expensive!
data.text: Went there for my son's birthday and was not happy with the quality of meals we were served.  Barely lukewarm soup, old mushy tomatoes in my salad, steaks were w-a-y overcooked (mine was actually burnt on the outside).  Not sure how they justify the cost of these meals.  None of us felt it was worth it nor would we return.

data.title: Never again! Poor quality food highway robbery!!
data.text: Going to the Bates Steakhouse experience was not one id like to relive. after waiting at the door for several minutes with no acknowledgment. We where then seated and to look at the menu it was priced at about %800 which is like five star dining normal is anywhere from %300-%500! i did not even want to order but i was on a first date. i ordered prime rib dinner and she ordered filet minonge. first they bring us a cast iron kettle of vegetable soup which was ok the pan was over kill with a four Oz ladle really big ladle whats wrong with serving a bowl of soup? well as a chef I can see some of the behind the scenes details of a plate. the salad was reaaaly small like a soup bowl or five or six bites... id rather have a nice dinner salad while i wait for my food rather then trying to put all the cost of the meal into veg. soup. plain black beans no salt no flavor. when my rib got to me it was missing the lip of the rib it was butchered! less then 8oz more like 6 1/2 0r 6-7. then the thing was luke warm and a real thick layer of sage and other gummie residue on top. while trying to pry through with my steak knife witch was like an over sized butter knife had trouble cutting through it.... also theses potatoes and rice came to the table with the meal just sliced whole not peeled potato rounds plain with rice. when i looked at my dates "filet minonge" it looked more like flank steak or some thing? i then googled filet minonge to make sure i was not going to be miss lead when i approached the server about it. so i was correct the filet minonge i say dose not look like the cut of meat we ordered? well for like $40 dollars i expect this to be non disputable plates here. the server then says about it they  are medalions? my date says it was rough to chew on and poor quality as well. now my stomach is acting up on me and im getting a deep belly ache!!! the sever was nice and very thorough she did very well and she gets four stars at putting up with the RIP OFF GRUEL that she has to serve at her job!! even though i did not feel entitled to pay an $88 dollar bill for one cocktail, coffee, prime rib dinner and filet minonge dinner!!

data.title: My Kind of Place
data.text: My wife and I disagree regarding what we choose to eat.  She likes chicken and I love beef.    We had never been to Eugene before and since we arrived right around 6 PM we wanted to find a place to eat.  We checked out a couple of places and actually walked in an right out of one place which did not have the menu or decor we felt comfortable with.  Then we saw the "Bates".  One look at the interior and the menu and I knew that I was in my element.  The selection of beef items on the menu was excellent and my ribeye was perfect.  Portions were excellent and we were quite satisfied.  The all you can eat soup, by the way, was outstanding.  Highly recommended

data.title: This is why reviews count...and I don't listen!
data.text: The hotel manager recommended this place for food and atmosphere. As I was waiting for the shuttle I looked up the reviews on here and on Google. Well, I should have listened. The food was below average. Rice was out of a box and the prime rib was less than a 1/4 inch thick, over cooked in some areas and under cooked in others. Tons of gristle and no seasoning. No or little seasoning on a good cut steak is the way it should be but at this place you better bring your spice rack. This place might need restaurant impossible.

data.title: Great prime rib and funky western atmosphere!
data.text: Dinner is served family style and you won't go away hungry.  Aside from filling, the food is tasty and the ambiance is fun!

data.title: Weird country uptown mix
data.text: I enjoyed the steak house idea when I chose to try this restaurant. Upon entering I was placed into a country feel and chose the "Saloon Room" to have my meal. The service was country friendly and my Margarita (which was delicious) was served in a boot shaped plastic glass. My blackened chicken was awesome and the salad and potatoes were very good as well. What I found strange was the high price and upscale plates my meal was served on. I felt the price reflected the fancy plate rather than a country style restaurant. I was the only customer on an early evening Thursday which leads me to conclude that others feel the same about this overpriced country dinner.

data.title: My Favorite Place in Eugene!
data.text: I love this place!! You definitely get what you pay for. Great food, quiet, low-lit atmosphere, great 80's & 90's country music playing, which is may favorite! I have no complains! By far the best restaurant in Eugene!
